channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Immigration bureau reach 78
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration said Thursday that 78 of its employees have contracted the novel coronavirus, as the government office implements more preventive measures to deter the spread of COVID-19.

item.title: Duterte faces cancer risk? Palace says warning is old
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The doctor’s advice to President Duterte for him to stop drinking was given a long time ago, Malacañang said yesterday, as it assured the public that the Chief Executive would be transparent when it comes to his health.

item.title: P2.5 billion allotted for COVID-19 vaccine, P2.7 billion for PPEs
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: The Duterte administration has earmarked P2.5 billion for the procurement of vaccines for COVID-19 and has set aside another P2.7 billion as “provision” for personal protective equipment for all hospitals and laboratory centers.

item.title: Duterte ponders martial law in Sulu
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte is assessing recommendations of the Armed Forces of the Philippines and the Philippine National Police to impose martial law in Sulu after recent bombings killed 15 victims and wounded about 72 others last Monday

item.title: 2 Jolo suicide bombers were terrorists’ widows
item.author: Roel Pareño
item.description: Two widows of Islamist terrorists were the ones who set off the improvised explosive devices last Monday in Sulu, killing themselves together with 15 state forces and civilians and wounding 78 others, according to military officials.

item.title: UK lauds OFW frontliners’ service, professionalism
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The United Kingdom is grateful for the professionalism and service of Filipino healthcare workers, its top diplomat in Manila said on Tuesday night.

item.title: Philippines won’t stop patrolling Spratlys – Locsin
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Rejecting China’s call to stop “illegal provocations” in the West Philippine Sea, Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. said the Philippines will not cease patrolling the Spratly Islands.

item.title: Mental health app for OFWs available
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Filipino workers in Macau can monitor their physical and mental health conditions by answering health-related questions on a weekly basis.

item.title: PNP orders probe of group behind revolutionary government
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Gen. Archie Gamboa has ordered an investigation of members of a group pushing for the establishment of a revolutionary government to be headed by President Duterte.

item.title: Morales quits PhilHealth
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Embattled Philippine Health Insurance Corp. president and chief executive officer Ricardo Morales yesterday resigned from his post, after President Duterte said it was best for him to quit PhilHealth because of his health problems.
